original_text:
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
**INSTITUTION
**PLACE , PA **ZIP-CODE
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
**ID-NUM
**ID-NUM
A5A/532
SERVICE OF :
**NAME[ZZZ M YYY]
DATE OF ADMISSION :
**DATE[Oct 26 2007]
DATE OF DISCHARGE :
**DATE[Oct 30 2007]
ADMISSION DIAGNOSIS :
Seizure disorder .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Seizure disorder with breakthrough seizure .
2. Delirium / postictal .
3. Hyponatremia .
4. Type 2 diabetes mellitus .
5. Hypothyroidism .
6. Hypertension .
7. Myelodysplasia with anemia and thrombocytopenia .
8. History of atrial fibrillation .
9. Gastroesophageal reflux disease .
10. History of coronary artery disease .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
Lamictal 200 p.o. b.i.d. with 100 p.o. nightly , Keppra 1500 mg p.o. b.i.d. , Cymbalta 30 mg q. day , Amaryl 2 mg b.i.d. , amiodarone 100 mg q. day , Lopressor 25 mg b.i.d. , Norvasc 10 mg q. day , Synthroid 125 mcg q. day , and Protonix 40 mg q. day , bowel regimen p.r.n.
Follow up with Dr. **NAME[YYY] in 3 weeks .
Follow up with Dr. **NAME[XXX] in 1 week for bone marrow biopsy .
Follow up with Dr. **NAME[WWW] in 6 weeks , appointment already made .
Dietary restrictions , diabetic diet .
Physical activity , home bound with home PT .
Prognosis is fair with a high readmission rate secondary to the recalcitrant nature of her seizures .
PRESENTING HISTORY :
Ms. **NAME[AAA] is a **AGE[in 70s]- year - old with a past medical history of recalcitrant seizure disorder who presented with a protracted seizure and severe confusion afterwards .
She had a seizure couple of weeks prior that was shorter in duration .
She was admitted for further workup and evaluation .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient was placed on telemetry .
A CT scan of her head was done which showed no acute changes .
Dr. **NAME[WWW] et al placed her on an increased dose of Lamictal and continued her Keppra .
The patient was postictal several days afterwards with waxing and waning levels of delirium .
There was some concern about recurrent seizures versus MCA insufficiency .
She was clear for 24 hours at discharge and discharged home with home PT .
The patient was scheduled as an outpatient for a bone marrow biopsy secondary to anemia and thrombocytopenia .
She has a known diagnosis of myelodysplasia that has become recalcitrant to Procrit .
It was scheduled for **DATE[Oct 31 2007] , but will be rescheduled for 1 week from now .
The patient had hyponatremia during her hospitalization .
Consults placed to Dr. **NAME[VVV] for nephrology .
She was fluid restricted initially and her sodium returned to normal .
It was felt to be secondary to her acute seizure .
Continue her outpatient fluid restrictions , which have been mild at home .
Other consults were placed to Dr. **NAME[UUU TTT] and Dr. **NAME[SSS WWW] .
___________________
**NAME[ZZZ M. YYY] , M.D.
Dict :
**DATE[Oct 30 2007] 10:13:55
Tran :
**DATE[Oct 31 2007] 08:44:55
DKB/ss/367609/**ID-NUM/**ID-NUM
R :
**DATE[Nov 01 2007] 05:01:49/yr
**CARBON-COPY
